text: Colonel Jean-Baptiste Bagaza (29 August 1926 - 4 May 2016) was a Burundian politician. He was the Chairman of the Supreme Revolutionary Council in Burundi until November 10, 1976. He was President from November 10, 1976 to September 3, 1987. Bagaza was deposed in a military coup d'Ã©tat. He was replaced as president by Pierre Buyoya. He went into exile in Uganda and later went to Libya, where he lived until 1993. Bagaza died from unknown causes at a hospital in Brussels, Belgium on 4 May 2016, aged 89. ==References== Category:1946 births Category:2016 deaths Category:Presidents of Burundi
title: Jean-Baptiste Bagaza
